Package net.jsocket

Class KeyExchangeMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.jsocket.KeyExchangeMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Message
    public class KeyExchangeMessage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Message
    Used during the handshake by the client to send the RSA encrypted AES key
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      KeyExchangeMessage​(javax.crypto.SecretKey symmetricKey, java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
      Initialises this KeyExchangeMessage and encrypts the symmetric AES key using an RSA keypair generated by the server

      Gets a description of the message being transported.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyExchangeMessage

        public KeyExchangeMessage​(javax.crypto.SecretKey symmetricKey,
                          java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
        Initialises this KeyExchangeMessage and encrypts the symmetric AES key using an RSA keypair generated by the server
        Parameters:
        symmetricKey - The symmetric key to be transported, should be used by the client and the server during the communication
        publicKey - The server's public key used to encrypt the symmetric AES key

    • Method Detail

      • getSymmetricKey

        public javax.crypto.SecretKey getSymmetricKey​(java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
        Decrypts the stored AES key and returns it
        Parameters:
        privateKey - The server's private key for this client
        Returns:
        The decrypted AES key

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Gets a description of the message being transported. It can be a textual representation of the data being sent or just a general use description
        Specified by:
        getDescription in interface Message
        Returns:
        String of the description
